acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) of 662mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-53 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 330ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 3.04mg/L (1 hour), 3.45mg/L (1 hour) and 4.619mg/L (4 hours) (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (250,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 19mmHg (20degC) (equivalent to 2,500Pa (20degC)) (NFPA (13th, 2001)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 120mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 120mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-53 (2001)) and 208mg/kg (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available Corrosivity to metals remains uncertain, though classified as "corrosive substances" (as the classification based on UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods includes "skin corrosivity") (UN#1752).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and negative data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests), described in ACGIH (7th, 2001).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine), with the oxygen and chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen, respectively (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "severe irritation" from rat eye irritation tests (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and human health effects (CERI-NITE Hazard Data 2000-53 (2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) of the human health effects - medical reports on the impact of acute exposure: dermal erythema, burn injury, eye irritation, lacrimation, dyspnea, cyanosis, adverse effects on the respiratory organs (cough, etc.) and alimentary canal.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "histopathological changes in the respiratory organs, visible lesions in the respiratory organs" (CERI Hazard Data  2000-53 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "severe eye/respiratory irritation, lacrimation, dyspnea, cyanosis, adverse effects on the respiratory organs (cough, etc.)" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-53 (2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "shallow respiration, labored breathing, pulmonary/nasal congestion" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-53 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
